question: GFR has been in news for amendments related to procurement of the Government. What does GFR stand for?
explanation:
The Union Government has notified amendments to General Financial Rules (GFR) 2017, to make goods and services valued less than Rs 200 crore are procured from domestic firms.
As announced in the recent economic stimulus package, global procurements will be disallowed up to Rs 200 Crore, which will reduce unfair competition among the domestic suppliers and MSMEs. GFR is amended such that the limit of procurement may be prescribed by the Department of Expenditure from time to time.
